resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete \"%s\"?
There was an error reading the saved servers from the disk.
There was error writing the server to the saved servers list. It will not be saved.
The specified server could not be found on the network.
The server sent unexpected data or no data at all.
The server unexpectedly closed the connection.
The server reported an error. Try again.
An error occurred while setting the volume. Try again.
An error occurred while processing the media command on the server. Try again.
A background thread received malformed or unexpected data.

About this app
	 This app is a simple client for changing the volume on a computer running Alsa (aka mainly Linux systems). To use it you must have the server installed and running on your computer with your firewall configured properly on the default port, 4242.


The source for the server, this application, and a desktop client, can be found on GitHub at https://github.com/shanet/Alsa-Channel-Control.
There are a few default channels included, but you'll likely want to add your own. You can find channels by running "alsamixer" on your computer in a terminal. Note that channels are case sensitive.
Any bugs or feature requests should be made at the GitHub page linked to above.


License
	 This application is open source software. It is free to distribute, modify, and use with the exception of it being made closed source and sold for commercial purposes without the consent of the author. However, the author simply requests that if you do something cool with it, you let him check it out by emailing shane@shanetully.com or just let him know you find it useful.

Current Version: 2.0.0 

2.0.0: 
	-Added media keys 
	-Updated protocol to work with the newest version of the server 
	-Connections with server kept open as long as possible 

1.1.0: 
	-Live volume changes instead of having a submit button 

1.0.1: 
	-Patched a few protocol issues 
	-Fixed Set Port dialog not showing 
	-Reworked the backend slightly 
	-Shows dialog when connecting to server if on slow connection 

1.0.0: 
	-Initial release! :D
